Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: Kidnapper

English

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • kidnaper

Etymology

[edit]

From kidnap +‎ -er.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • (General American) IPA(key): /ˈkɪdnæpɚ/
  • Audio (Southern England):(file)

Noun

[edit]

kidnapper (plural kidnappers)

  1. A person who kidnaps someone.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • birdnapper
  • carnapper
  • catnapper
  • dognapper
  • petnapper
  • pignapper

Related terms

[edit]
  • kidnap

Translations

[edit]
one who performs kidnap
  • Arabic: مُخْتَطِف m (muḵtaṭif)
  • Belarusian: выкрада́льнік m (vykradálʹnik), выкрада́льніца f (vykradálʹnica)
  • Bulgarian: похити́тел (bg) m (pohitítel), похити́телка f (pohitítelka)
  • Catalan: segrestador m
  • Chinese:
    Cantonese: 拐子佬 (gwaai2 zi2 lou2)
    Mandarin: 誘拐者 / 诱拐者 (yòuguǎizhě), 綁架者 / 绑架者 (bǎngjiàzhě), 劫持者 (jiéchízhě)
  • Czech: únosce m, únoskyně f
  • Danish: kidnapper c, bortfører c
  • Dutch: kidnapper (nl) m, ontvoerder (nl) m, schaker (nl) m
  • Estonian: inimröövija
  • Finnish: sieppaaja (fi), kidnappaaja (fi)
  • French: ravisseur (fr) m, ravisseuse (fr) f, kidnappeur (fr) m, kidnappeuse (fr) f
  • Galician: secuestrador m
  • Georgian: გამტაცებელი (gamṭacebeli), მომტაცებელი (momṭacebeli)
  • German: Entführer (de) m, Entführerin (de) f
  • Greek: απαγωγέας (el) m (apagogéas)
  • Hindi: अपहरणकर्ता m (apharaṇkartā), अपहर्ता (hi) m (aphartā)
  • Hungarian: emberrabló (hu), gyermekrabló (hu)
  • Icelandic: mannræningi m
  • Italian: rapitore (it) m, rapitrice (it) f
  • Japanese: 誘拐犯 (ゆうかいはん, yūkaihan)
  • Korean: 유괴범(誘拐犯) (ko) (yugoebeom), 납치범(拉致犯) (napchibeom), 랍치범(拉致犯) (rapchibeom) (North Korea)
  • Latin: plagiārius m, plagiāria m
  • Macedonian: грабнувач m (grabnuvač), грабнувачка f (grabnuvačka), киднапе́р m (kidnapér), киднапе́рка f (kidnapérka)
  • Norwegian:
    Bokmål: kidnapper (no) m, barnerøver (child kidnapper), kidnapperske m or f (female), barnenapper m
  • Old English: manþēof m
  • Polish: porywacz (pl) m, porywaczka f, uprowadziciel m, uprowadzicielka f
  • Portuguese: sequestrador (pt) m
  • Romanian: răpitor (ro) m, răpitoare (ro) f
  • Russian: похити́тель (ru) m (poxitítelʹ), похити́тельница (ru) f (poxitítelʹnica)
  • Serbo-Croatian:
    Roman: òtmičār (sh) m, ljudokradica f
  • Slovak: únosca m, únoskyňa f
  • Slovene: ugrabitelj m, ugrabiteljica f
  • Spanish: secuestrador (es) m, raptor (es) m, captor (es) m
  • Swahili: mtekaji nyara
  • Swedish: kidnappare (sv) c
  • Turkish: çocuk hırsızı
  • Ukrainian: викрада́ч m (vykradáč), викрада́чка f (vykradáčka)
  • Yoruba: gbọ́mọgbọ́mọ

Dutch

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio:(file)

Noun

[edit]

kidnapper m (plural kidnappers, diminutive kidnappertje n)

  1. a person who kidnaps someone

Synonyms

[edit]
  • ontvoerder

Related terms

[edit]
  • schaker

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from English kidnap.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kid.na.pe/
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

kidnapper

  1. to kidnap
    Synonym: enlever
  2. (colloquial) to steal
    Synonym: voler

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of kidnapper (see also Appendix:French verbs)

compound avoir + past participle
present participle or gerund1 simple kidnappant
/kid.na.pɑ̃/

past participle kidnappé

compound — simple imperative of avoir + past participle — simple imperative of avoir + past participle simple imperative of avoir + past participle —
1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Further reading

[edit]
  • “kidnapper”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Norwegian Bokmål

[edit]

Etymology 1

[edit]

Borrowed from English kidnapper.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kidˈnapər/
  • Rhymes: -apər

Noun

[edit]

kidnapper m (definite singular kidnapperen, indefinite plural kidnappere, definite plural kidnapperne)

  1. a kidnapper
Related terms
[edit]
  • kidnappe
  • kidnapping

See also

[edit]
  • kidnappar (Nynorsk)

Etymology 2

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

kidnapper

  1. present of kidnappe

References

[edit]
  • “kidnapper” in The Bokmål Dictionary.
